text: Harimau Malaya are set to play their remaining pre-World Cup/Asian Cup Group G matches on June 3-15. According to the Asian Football Confederation (AFC), Malaysia will take on the United Arab Emirates on June 3, followed by Vietnam on June 11 and Thailand four days later. The venues, however, will be announced later. The AFC had postponed the March dates due to Covid-19 concerns. After five matches, Malaysia are second with nine points in Group G, behind  Vietnam (11 points), followed by Thailand (eight), UAE (six) and Indonesia, who have yet to secure points. Skip
